reqProfiles.desc:
Use Request Profiler to Manage profiling based on the request sent to webserver.

This section can be used to configure the rules by specifying the method of request, protocol of request, referrer and user agent.

This section Enables you to block or allow the particular websites, by using hostname(website).

By using this section, you can keep the social networking websites (Facebook, Twitter) for read-only purpose. You cannot like, comment, share, chat and game.

This section helps you to enforce the safe search for Google, yahoo, YouTube

enabled.desc: Enable or Disable request types section.

comment.desc:
For documentation, and future references, explain the relevance of this entry with your policies.

That is, by reading the policies, a future user can understand the purpose of that entry.

profile_tracing.desc:
Enable or Disable tracing of this entry

Select "Yes" to debug the application of entry using SafeSquid logs.

Enabling entry tracing, is useful if you wish to validate, its application.

req_types.desc: Comma separated list of Request Profiles to which this entry will be applied. Due to this entry in the list, one or more Request Profiles are already applied (ADDED REQUEST PROFILES) to the connection. If kept Blank, it will apply to all connections irrespective of any applied request profile.

method.desc: This entry applies to requests matching the selected list of Method(s). If this entry should be applied to all requests irrespective of methods, do not select any method.

protocol.desc:
This entry applies to requests matching the selected list of protocol(s).

If this entry should be applied to all requests irrespective of protocols, do not select any protocol.

content_types.desc:
This entry applies to regular expression matching to the MIME-type.

Here MIME-type indicates the entity-body sent to the recipient (used with POST and PUT requests).

Request Type is the type of request sent by the requester such as an incident or request for any information.

Example: Content-Type: application/x-www-form-url encoded. If this entry should be applied to all requests irrespective of MIME-type, leave it blank.

portrange.desc:
Comma separated list of port or port ranges to

which this entry will be applied.

Here port range indicates TCP port(s) number on which the server is listening.

Example: value "80, 21-25" means port 80 and port range from 21 to 25.

It applies to all ports if left blank.

urlcommand.desc:
Comma separated list of URL command(s) to which this entry will be applied.

If this entry should be applied to all requests irrespective of any url command, leave it blank.

https

For https requests.

!https

For other than https requests.

postdata_min_length.desc:
This entry applies only if Request body is more than this size.
Example: Content-Length: 48

postdata_max_length.desc:
This entry applies only if Request body is less than this size.
Example: Content-Length: 480

file.desc:
This entry applies to regular expression matching the file portion of requested web-server (the part of a URL that succeeds hostname).

Leave it blank to apply all the requests irrespective of file portion of URI (Uniform Resource Identifier).


Example: (cgi-bin|\?) will apply to queries in a URL.

hostname.desc:
This entry applies to regular expression matching the hostname(website) of requested web-server.

Leave it blank to apply this entry to all the requests irrespective of hostname(s).


Example: Host: en.wikipedia.org

smart_tld.desc:
Enable this option if the regex for Host Name should be used to match irrespective of the TLD.
Specify google$ in Host Name and set smart TLD to enabled to ensure match for google.com or google.co.uk or google.co.in.
If you strictly want to create a policy for mail.google.com, then you should set Smart TLD to disabled and mention Host Name as mail\.google\.com

referer.desc:
This entry applies to regular expression matching the referrer (the address of the resource from which the requested URI was obtained) of requested web-server.

Leave it blank to apply all requests irrespective of referrer of the header.


Example: Referer: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page

user_agent.desc:
This entry applies to regular expression matching to a specific internet client or web client (application requesting the information from the server).

Leave it blank to apply all requests irrespective of any application requesting the information from the server.


Example: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:12.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/21.0

xforwardedfor.desc:
This entry applies to regular expression matching the X-Forwarded-For (the IP address from where the original request came from either proxy or load balancer).

Leave it blank to apply for all requests irrespective of X-forwarded.


Example: X-Forwarded-For: 129.78.138.66.

requestheader.desc: This entry applies to regular expression matching the request header pattern. Apply to all request patterns, if left blank.

add_req_types.desc: Comma separated list of Request Profiles that will be added to connection, if the above specified tests results are true.

remove_req_types.desc:
Comma separated list of Request Profiles to be removed when all the above rules match.

If any of these Request profiles have been already applied to the connection by any of the other Request Profile rules, they will be removed.

comment.desc:
For documentation, and future references, explain the relevance of this entry with your policies.

This ensures, a future user can understand the purpose of this entry.

hosts.desc:
List of Domains and URLs.

Multiple Domains and URLs may be specified.
This Entry shall be applicable for Requests to any of the specified Domains and URLs.
Comma, space, tab, newline are all acceptable separators (delimiters).

Leaving it blank will cause this Entry to apply to all requests.

Do not include:
The preceeding protocol specifiers such as http:// or https://
Wild-Card specifiers such as *

Acceptable Examples:
safesquid.com
www.safesquid.com
safesquid.com/some/file/path

where.desc: Check if the requested host or the referer matches one of the specified domains and URLs

add_req_types.desc: Comma separated list of Request Profiles that will be added to the connection, if it matches this Entry.

domains.remove_req_types:
Removed Request Types add_app_category,add_app_signatures,add_req_types0 STRING_LIST 0

Comma separated list of Request Profiles that will be removed from the connection, if it matches this Entry.

FALSE.desc: Select this option to disable profile tracing.

TRUE.desc: Select this option to enable profile tracing.

GET.desc: GET method is used to retrieve information from server using a given requested web-server. Requests using GET should only retrieve data and should have no other effect on the data. Select this if you want to apply this entry for requests with GET method.

POST.desc:
POST method is used to submit data to be processed (Example: customer information, file upload etc. using HTML forms).
The data is included in the body of the request. This may result in the creation of a new resource or the updates of existing resources or both. Select this if you want to apply this entry for requests with POST method.

CONNECT.desc: CONNECT Converts the request connection to a transparent TCP/IP tunnel, usually to facilitate SSL-encrypted communication(HTTPS) through an unencrypted HTTP proxy(e.g. SSL tunnelling). Select this if you want to apply this entry for requests with CONNECT method.

HEAD.desc: HEAD method is identical to GET. However in response to HEAD request server shall not return a message body. Select this if you want to apply this entry for requests with HEAD method.

PUT.desc: PUT method is used to upload a representation of the specified resource. If request for any web-server refers to an already existing resource, it will be modified. Otherwise server can create the resource with present URI(Uniform Resource Identifier). Select this if you want to apply this entry for requests with PUT method.

DELETE.desc: DELETE method removes the specified resource. It intends to delete the resource or move it to an inaccessible location identified by the requested web-server. Select this if you want to apply this entry for requests with DELETE method.

TRACE.desc: TRACE Echoes back the received request, so that a client can see what intermediate servers are adding or changing in the request. The final recipient of the request SHOULD reflect the message received back to the client as the entity-body of a 200 (OK) response. Select this if you want to apply this entry for requests with TRACE method.

OPTIONS.desc: OPTIONS method returns the HTTP methods that server supports for specified URL. OPTIONS can be used to check the functionality of a web server by requesting * instead of a specific resource. Select this if you want to apply this entry for requests with OPTIONS method. Unused.

FTP.desc: File Transfer Protocol(FTP) is a standard network protocol used to transfer files from any host to another host over a TCP-based network. Select this if you want to apply this entry for FTP clients.

HTTP.desc: Hypertext Transfer Protocol(HTTP) is an application protocol for distributed, collaborative, hypermedia information systems. HTTP is the protocol to exchange or transfer hypertext. Select this if you want to apply this entry for HTTP clients.

HTTPS.desc: Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) is a communications protocol for secure communication over a computer network. Very first request for HTTPS will be CONNECT request, subsequently it will be changed to HTTPS. Therefore lower down in protocol it is HTTPS request. Select this if you want to apply this entry for HTTP clients who want to access websites using SSL.

FALSE.desc: The regex contains specific TLD for which the match is required

TRUE.desc: Ignore TLD of the requested Host Name while matching regex.

Host.desc:
Requested Host
Check if Requested Host is among the specified Domains And Urls

Referer.desc:
Request Referer
Check if Request Referer is among the specified Domains And Urls

Both.desc:
Requested Host or Request Referer
Check if either Requested Host or Request Referer is among the specified Domains And Urls

request_hosts.desc:
Each connection is tested against all Entries from top to bottom for applicability.

Disabled Entries are ignored.

The Added Request Types specified in a matching Entries shall be appended to the Connection's Request Types.

The Removed Request Types specified in a matching Entries shall be removed to the Connection's Request Types.

request_section.desc:
This is a list of Entries that profiles a request as one or more Request Types.
Each request is tested against the Entries, from top to bottom.
Each Entry is constituted by a set of Rules.
A disabled Entry is ignored.
An Entry is applicable if a request satisfies all its Rules.
If an Entry is found to be applicable:
The Request Type(s) specified in the Added Request Types rule of the Entry, are appended to the request's then list of profiles.
The Request Type(s) specified in the Removed Request Types rule of the Entry, are removed from the request's then list of profiles.
Thus a request may be labelled with multiple Request Types.

respProfiles.desc:
Use Response profiles to manage profiling based on the responses received from the webserver.

You can manage Profiling based on the following parameters present in the responses received from the webserver.


  • Mime
  • File
  • Content-Length
  • Response header pattern, etc.,

enabled.desc: Enable or Disable response types section.

comment.desc: Explain the relevance of this entry with your policies, for documentation, and future references.

profile_tracing.desc:
Enable or Disable Tracing of this entry.

Select "Yes" to debug the application of entry using SafeSquid logs.

Enable entry tracing, is useful if you wish to validate, its application.

res_types.desc:
Specify the list of Response Profile(s) for which this entry should be applicable.
Leave it Blank, to ignore this applicability test.
If one or more Response Profiles are specified, this entry will be applicable, only after response has been received from the web server.
To avoid application to a connection for specific Response Profile(s), use negation (! Response Profile)

mime.desc:
Specify the MIME-type for which this entry should be applicable.
MIME-type is a way of identifying files on the Internet according to their nature and format.
Here, MIME-type indicates the response-body received from the server.
This entry applies to the regular expression matching the MIME-type.
Example: text/html, ^image/, ^application/, application/x-shockwave-flash.
If this entry should be applied to all responses, irrespective of MIME-type, leave it blank

file_extension.desc:
Specify the file extensions for which this entry should be applicable.
This entry applies to the regular expression matching the extension of file(s) obtained in response body.
Leave it blank to apply all the requests, irrespective of file extension.

transfer_encoding_chunk.desc:
This option is to control how the transfer encoding chunk header should be handled.
Example: Transfer-Encoding: chunked

multipart_byterange.desc: This option is to control how the multi part/ byte ranges header should be handled. Example: Content-type: multipart/x-byteranges; boundary=THIS_STRING_SEPARATES --THIS_STRING_SEPARATES Content-type: application/x-pdf Content-range: bytes 500-999/8000 ...the first range... --THIS_STRING_SEPARATES Content-type: application/x-pdf Content-range: bytes 7000-7999/8000 ...the second range... --THIS_STRING_SEPARATES--

content_min_length.desc: Specify the minimum content size of the response body for which this entry is applicable.

content_max_length.desc: Specify the maximum content size of the response body for which this entry is applicable.

responseheader.desc:
Specify the regular expression matching the response header pattern for which this entry is applicable.
If left blank, it applies to all response patterns.

add_res_types.desc:
Specify the list of Response Profiles, to append to the connectionâ€™s existing Response Profiles, if all the applicability test rules match.
Subsequent applicable Entry may further modify the connectionâ€™s Response Profiles.
Define a new Response Profile(s), or Select previously defined Response Profile(s) from the drop-down menu to apply to the connection, if it matches this entry.
When defining a new Response Profile, use terms that uniquely represent your needs.

remove_res_types.desc:
Specify the list of Response Profile(s), to remove the connectionâ€™s existing Profiles, if all the applicability test rules match.
Subsequent applicable Entry may further modify the connectionâ€™s Response Profiles.
Select previously defined Response Profile(s) from the drop-down menu to apply to the connection, if it matches this entry.

FALSE.desc: Select this option to disable profile tracing.

TRUE.desc: Select this option to enable profile tracing.

FALSE.desc: Select this if you don\'t want to apply profile if transfer encoding chunked present in response header.

TRUE.desc: Select this if you want to apply profile if transfer encoding chunked present in response header.

ANY.desc: Select this if transfer encoding chunked does not matter in response header.

FALSE.desc: Select this if you don\'t want to apply profile if multipart/ byteranges present in response header.

TRUE.desc: Select this if you want to apply profile if multipart/ byteranges present in response header.

ANY.desc: Select this if multipart/ byterange does not matter in response header.

response_section.desc:
The following rules are tested for each connection.

The testing is done in top-down order.

The first entry that matches the Response Profile of a connection, will be applied to it. Click on Add below, to add a new entry.

sslcert.desc:
This section allows you to configure the overall operation to handle scanning of connections under HTTPS (HTTP over SSL).

SSL (Secure Sockets Layer), is the standard security technology for encrypting a connection between a web server and a browser.

Once established, this connection will encrypt all traffic and ensure that all data passed between the web server and browser remains private.

You must set this carefully, depending on the usage of web applications handling HTTPS requests, particularly web 2.0 applications.

All HTTPS requests are matched with the rules defined under the HTTPS scanning policies and actions taken based on the matching entry.

enabled.desc: Enable or Disable HTTPS inspection section.

comment.desc:
For documentation, and future references, explain the relevance of this entry with your policies.

That is, by reading the policies, a future user can understand the purpose of that entry.

profiles.desc:
Specify the Profiles applicable for this entry.

This entry will be applicable only if the connection has any one of the specified profiles.

Leave it Blank, to apply for all connections, irrespective of any applied profile.

To avoid application to a connection that has a profile, use negated profile (! profile).

deepscan.desc: Decide if you want to enable scanning within encrypted SSL connections matching this entry.

block_no_cert.comment: Block Access to Sites that do not have an SSL Certificate
block_no_cert.desc: Decide whether Sites that do not have SSL Certificate should be blocked or not.

block_err_level.desc:
SafeSquid verifies the SSL certificate to remote SSL web-servers.

You can specify here, the acceptable level of error.

Only in specific or exceptional cases choose anything besides X509_V_OK.

block_domain_mismatch.comment: Block domain mismatch in the web-site SSL certificate
block_domain_mismatch.desc:
Decide whether domain name mismatch is to be allowed or no.

SafeSquid validates the DNS and Common Name in the SSL certificates supplied by the remote web-server.

Only in exceptional cases set this as FALSE.

comment.desc: Explain the relevance of this entry with your policies, for documentation, and future references.

proxy_server.desc: Specify the host name of the proxy server as specified in the Startup Parameters.

enc_pwd.desc: Specify the Encrypted password for disk based caching of SSL certificates.

ssl_cache_store_size.desc:
Configure SSL cache size.

SSL cache size is used to set max store sizes for SSL session and context stores.

This setting affects memory consumption and performance.

Memory consumption is proportional to this setting.

It is recommended to set as 500, if the server's RAM size is less than 8GB.

If the size is more than 8GB then set up to 1000.

You have to set Store size at the beginning itself.

You need to restart if you want to change it.

SSL_download.appcontent:
Upload files

* Upload private key file with "ROOT_PrivateKeyFile.pem" name only

* Upload public key file with "ROOT_X509File.cer" name only

* Upload trusted-ca certificate with ".crt" extension only

https_scan.desc:
Each CONNECT request is tested only once for the applicability of the following entries.

The first matching entry is applied, and the rest are ignored.

If the matching entry deems that a Deep Scan should not be performed, the CONNECT request is handled without inspecting the subsequent requests.

If, however the matching entry seems a Deep Scan should be performed, the connection to the remote webserver is security checked for SSL properties as per the rule in the matched entry.

If the remote webserver fails to meet the desired standards, connection to that webserver is terminated.

Note: Deep Scan should only be performed on encrypted connections, if the underlying application protocol is HTTP.

Applications like Google drive, Subversion Client, WinScp, etc., do not work if you attempt a Deep Scan on them.

server_config.desc:
List of Security Passphrase(s) or Server Policies required to generate or load an existing ROOT CA SSL Certificate (RCSC).

The first matching entry below is used and the remaining is ignored.

RCSC is created automatically, if none exists already.

If an RCSC exists, passphrase in the applicable entry is used to load it.

The Private key of the generated RCSC can be used only with the passphrase used to generate it.

The passphrase prevents the private key of your RCSC from being stolen or fraudulent use.

After you generate RCSC successfully, you can download the public key of your RCSC from http://safesquid.cfg/safesquid.cer.

The public key must be installed on all the Web-Clients and browsers that are subjected to Deep Scan.

Download_SSL.desc:
Download: Download the SafeSquid certificate.
Upload: Upload the corporate certificates or corporate trusted-ca-certificate.
Cache Refresh: Refresh the SSL cache.

FALSE.desc: Select this option to disable Deep Scanning.

TRUE.desc: Select this option to enable Deep Scanning.

FALSE.desc: Select this option only if you want to allow SSL access to web-sites without SSL certificates.

TRUE.desc: This is the default and safe option.

FALSE.desc: Select this option only if you want to allow SSL access to web-sites that are using certificates issued to domains other than the web-site.

TRUE.desc: This is the default and safe option.

X509_V_OK.desc: ok The operation was successful. This is the default and safest option.

X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_GET_ISSUER_CERT.desc: Unable to get issuer certificate The issuer certificate of a looked up certificate could not be found. This normally means the list of trusted certificates is not complete.

X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_GET_CRL.desc: Unable to get certificate CRL. The CRL of a certificate could not be found.

X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_DECRYPT_CERT_SIGNAT.desc: Unable to decrypt certificate\'s signature. The certificate signature could not be decrypted. This means that the actual signature value could not be determined rather than it not matching the expected value, this is only meaningful for RSA keys.

X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_DECRYPT_CRL_SIGNATU.desc: Unable to decrypt CRL\'s signature. The CRL signature could not be decrypted: this means that the actual signature value could not be determined rather than it not matching the expected value. Unused.

X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_DECODE_ISSUER_PUBLI.desc: Unable to decode issuer public key The public key in the certificate SubjectPublicKeyInfo could not be read.

X509_V_ERR_CERT_SIGNATURE_FAILURE.desc: Certificate signature failure The signature of the certificate is invalid.

X509_V_ERR_CRL_SIGNATURE_FAILURE.desc: CRL signature failure The signature of the certificate is invalid.

X509_V_ERR_CERT_NOT_YET_VALID.desc: Certificate is not yet valid The certificate is not yet valid: the notBefore date is after the current time.

X509_V_ERR_CERT_HAS_EXPIRED.desc: Certificate has expired. The certificate has expired: that is the notAfter date is before the current time.

X509_V_ERR_CRL_NOT_YET_VALID.desc: CRL is not yet valid The CRL is not yet valid.

X509_V_ERR_CRL_HAS_EXPIRED.desc: CRL has expired The CRL has expired.

X509_V_ERR_ERROR_IN_CERT_NOT_BEFORE_FIEL.desc: Format error in certificate\'s notBefore field. The certificate notBefore field contains an invalid time.

X509_V_ERR_ERROR_IN_CERT_NOT_AFTER_FIELD.desc: Format error in certificate\'s notAfter field The certificate notAfter field contains an invalid time.

X509_V_ERR_ERROR_IN_CRL_LAST_UPDATE_FIEL.desc: Format error in CRL\'s lastUpdate field. The CRL lastUpdate field contains an invalid time.

X509_V_ERR_ERROR_IN_CRL_NEXT_UPDATE_FIEL.desc: Format error in CRL\'s nextUpdate field. The CRL nextUpdate field contains an invalid time.

X509_V_ERR_OUT_OF_MEM.desc: Out of memory. An error occurred trying to allocate memory. This should never happen.

X509_V_ERR_DEPTH_ZERO_SELF_SIGNED_CERT.desc: Self signed certificate. The passed certificate is self signed and the same certificate cannot be found in the list of trusted certificates. Note: Acceptable secenario is when the webserver is privately owned by orgaization.

X509_V_ERR_SELF_SIGNED_CERT_IN_CHAIN.desc: Self signed certificate in certificate chain. The certificate chain could be built up using the untrusted certificates but the root could not be found locally.

X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_GET_ISSUER_CERT_LOC.desc: Unable to get local issuer certificate. The issuer certificate could not be found: this occurs if the issuer certificate of an untrusted certificate cannot be found.

X509_V_ERR_UNABLE_TO_VERIFY_LEAF_SIGNATU.desc: Unable to verify the first certificate. No signatures could be verified because the chain contains only one certificate and it is not self signed.

X509_V_ERR_CERT_CHAIN_TOO_LONG.desc: Certificate chain too long. The certificate chain length is greater than the supplied maximum depth. Unused.

X509_V_ERR_CERT_REVOKED.desc: Certificate revoked. The certificate has been revoked.

X509_V_ERR_INVALID_CA.desc: Invalid CA certificate. A CA certificate is invalid. Either it is not a CA or its extensions are not consistent with the supplied purpose.

X509_V_ERR_PATH_LENGTH_EXCEEDED.desc: Path length constraint exceeded. The basic Constraints pathlength parameter has been exceeded.

X509_V_ERR_INVALID_PURPOSE.desc: Unsupported certificate purpose. The supplied certificate cannot be used for the specified purpose.

X509_V_ERR_CERT_UNTRUSTED.desc: Certificate not trusted. The root CA is not marked as trusted for the specified purpose.

X509_V_ERR_CERT_REJECTED.desc: Certificate rejected. The root CA is marked to reject the specified purpose.

X509_V_ERR_SUBJECT_ISSUER_MISMATCH.desc: Subject issuer mismatch. The current candidate issuer certificate was rejected because its subject name did not match the issuer name of the current certificate. Only displayed when the -issuer_checks option is set.

X509_V_ERR_AKID_SKID_MISMATCH.desc: Authority and subject key identifier mismatch. The current candidate issuer certificate was rejected because its subject key identifier was present and did not match the authority key identifier current certificate. Only displayed when the -issuer_checks option is set.

X509_V_ERR_AKID_ISSUER_SERIAL_MISMATCH.desc: Authority and issuer serial number mismatch. The current candidate issuer certificate was rejected because its issuer name and serial number was present and did not match the authority key identifier of the current certificate. Only displayed when the -issuer_checks option is set.

X509_V_ERR_KEYUSAGE_NO_CERTSIGN.desc: Key usage does not include certificate signing. The current candidate issuer certificate was rejected because its keyUsage extension does not permit certificate signing.

X509_V_ERR_APPLICATION_VERIFICATION.desc: Application verification failure. An application specific error.

template.subscription_template:
Upload Activation Key



click here to upload

Upload Activation Key

templates.desc:
Customized templates can be really useful:

When you want to display error messages in a language other than English

(Or)

When you want to display Company logo, Warnings, Custom messages and notifications

Templates are used throughout SafeSquid.

That is done as a replacement for pages which can't be displayed due to filtering, error, or other conditions.

SafeSquid has many default templates.

You can replace the default templates with your customized templates.

A template may not necessarily be in html style, but can also be almost about anything like an audio file, flash file or an executable.

FALSE.desc: Select parsable to false if you do not want to parse the template.

TRUE.desc: Select parsable to true if you want to parse the template.

FILE.desc: The contents of the file will be sent.

EXECUTABLE.desc: The file is executed and whatever is it's output on the STDOUT, is sent as the template.

comment.desc:
For documentation, and future references, explain the relevance of this entry with your policies.

That is, by reading the policies, a future user can understand the purpose of that entry.

profiles.desc:
Specify the Profiles applicable for this entry.

This entry will be applicable only if the connection has any one of the specified profiles.

Leave it Blank, to apply for all connections irrespective of any applied profile.

To avoid application to a connection that has a profile, use negated profile (! profile).

name.desc: Specify the name of the template here, for identification, and this is used in other sections for reference purpose.

file.desc:
Specify the filename of the template, here. You have to mention the path (location) of the file here.

A template may not necessarily be in html pattern, but can be almost about anything like an audio file, flash file or an executable one.

mime.desc:
Specify MIME-type of the template, here.

While using an executable template, this is set, by having the external program send a HTTP response header.

code.desc: The response code to be used when sending the template

type.desc: Specify the type of the template.

parsable.desc:
Choose here whether or not to substitute the variables present in the HTML codes used to display the template.

There are several variables that can be used in templates if the parsable option is selected, which will be replaced with information about the request currently being handled. These variables can be used to generate content in real time.

template.desc: Create list of entries for different templates.

timeProfiles.desc:
Use Time Profiler to setup your Time based Internet Access policies.

The time ranges are: Month range, Day range, Weekday range, Hour range and Minute range.

Create an Entry to define Time Profile(s) as a combination of one or more combinations of time ranges.

Time Profiler Enables you to allow or block the categories, websites based on the time ranges.

enabled.desc: Enable or Disable time profiles section.

comment.desc:
For documentation, and future references, explain the relevance of this entry with your policies.

That is, by reading the policies, a future user can understand the purpose of that entry.

profile_tracing.desc:
Enable or Disable Tracing of this entry.

Select "Yes" to debug the application of entry using SafeSquid logs.

Enable entry tracing, is useful if you wish to validate, its application.

timeprofiles.desc:
Specify the list of Time Profile(s) for which this entry should be applicable.

Leave it Blank, to ignore this applicability test.

This entry will be applicable only if the connection has at-least one of the specified Time Profile(s).

To avoid application of this entry to a connection that has a Time Profile, use negation (! Weekday).

Go to Time Profiler to review, or define new Time Profiles.

tmonth.desc:
Set the month range for which this entry is active.

By default, it applies to all months.

For example:

January to March: Keeps this policy active from the month of January through March.

tday.desc:
Set the day range for which this entry is active.

By default, it applies to all days.

For example: Day 5 to 15 keeps this profile active from day 5th through day 15th.

If you mentioned month range as January to March, then this profile will be active after every month 5 to 15 from January through March.

tweekday.desc:
Set the weekday range for which this entry is active.

By default, it applies to all weekdays.

For example: Monday to Thursday: Keeps this profile active from Monday through Thursday.

If you mentioned Month Range and Day Range, then this profile is active for a combination of all ranges. (Month Range + Day range + weekday range).

thour.desc:
Set the hour range for which this entry is active. By default, it applies to every hour.

For example: Hour 9 to 12: keeps this profile active from 9 AM to 12 PM.

tminute.desc:
Set the minute range for which this entry is active, if left blank applies to every minute. This can be used in conjunction with Hour Range.

For example: If the hour range is 9 to 12 and minute range is 15 to 30, then the profile remains active from 9:15 through 12:30.

matchmode.desc: Select the appropriate mode to match the multiple time ranges.

add_time_profiles.desc:
Specify the list of Profiles, to append to the connectionâ€™s existing Profiles, if all the applicability test rules match.

Subsequent applicable Entry may further modify the connectionâ€™s Profiles.

Define a new Profile(s), or Select previously defined Profile(s) from the drop-down menu to apply to the connection, if it matches this entry.

When defining a new Profile, use terms that uniquely represent your needs.

You can use added profiles in Virus scanning, SSL inspection and other filtering sections.

remove_time_profiles.desc:
Specify the list of Profile(s), to remove the connectionâ€™s existing Profiles, if all the applicability test rules match.

Subsequent applicable Entry may further modify the connectionâ€™s Profiles.

Select previously defined Profile(s) from the drop-down menu to apply to the connection, if it matches this entry.

FALSE.desc: Select this option to disable profile tracing.

TRUE.desc: Select this option to enable profile tracing.

ABSOLUTETIME.desc: When the absolute time match mode is used, any time between the starting and ending time only will match.

ALLRANGES.desc: With the all ranges time match mode however, a time within all of the ranges will match.

time_section.desc:
Create list of Entries to implement your Time profile Policies.

Safesquid evaluates the entries in the order of top to bottom.

All the entries within the time range are applicable.

Add month, day, weekday, hour and minute ranges for each entry.

Each entry will be applicable for all combinations mentioned in that entry.

Click on ADD below to create a new policy.

Example:
Month range: January to May
Day range: 1 to 15
Weekday range: Monday to Friday
Hour range: 9 to 16
Minute range: 30 to 00

The Above profile will block all social categories, every month 1st-15th, from Jan to May and every day from 9:30 AM to 4:00 PM, from Monday to Friday, if you select Time match mode as allranges.

The Above profile will block all social categories, every month 1st-15th, from Jan to May and every week from Monday- 9:30 AM to Friday - 4:00 PM, if you select Time match mode as absolutemode.

rewrite.desc:
Use 'Content modifier' to remove or modify contents like ActiveX, JavaScript and Cookies from the selected websites.

It enables you to modify the content of web pages, files, the client header, and server header in real time.

CLIENT.desc: Rewrite the client header, this happens before Middleaman parses it so be careful not to remove any headers needed to handle the request properly.

SERVER.desc: Rewrite the header from the remote web server, same conditions from client header apply.

BODY.desc: Rewrite the body of the webpage or file.

POST.desc: Rewrite POST/PUT data sent when submitting a form or uploading a file.

enabled.desc: Enable or Disable Rewrite of Protocol Headers, and Payload Entity

comment.desc:
For documentation, and future references, explain the relevance of this entry with your policies.

That is, by reading the policies, a future user can understand the purpose of that entry.

profiles.desc:
Specify the Profiles applicable for this entry.

This entry will be applicable only if the connection has any one of the specified profiles.

Leave it Blank, to apply for all connections irrespective of any applied profile.

To avoid application to a connection that has a profile, use negated profile (! profile).

mime.desc:
Specify regular expression matching the MIME-type's for which this entry is applicable.

According to their nature and format, MIME-type is a way of identifying files on the Internet.

It is highly advisable that you set this to some mime-type; otherwise, all files will be checked.

Example: text/html, ^image/, ^application/, application/x-shockwave-flash.

pattern.desc:
A regular expression pattern matching the area of text inside the file, â€˜to modifyâ€™

This may be trailed with a '/' followed by flag characters like in Perl to modify options used to compile the regular expression, and must be if a '/' is used anywhere else in the regular expression.

replace.desc:
Specify the replacement text to use in place of the area of text, matching the pattern mentioned in the above field.

It may contain back references to strings captured using parenthesis in the pattern.

which.desc: This option is to select what the rewrite entry applies to.

rewrite.desc: List of regular expression substitutions to apply on matching files.

sscore.desc:
SScore allows you to categorize the websites, depending upon the potential nature of the content served by the web-site.

SScore queries SafeSquid's Content Categorisation Service (CCS), to determine if a web-site belongs to one or more categories.

enabled.desc: Enable or Disable the use of SScore engine.

heuristic.desc:
Enable or Disable the Heuristic scanning.

Enabling heuristic scanning allows you to analyze the content of a web page (response) in real-time and categorize the site instead of just URL based categorization.

elevated.desc:
Use Elevated Privacy to protect privacy activity across different websites.

Otherwise, third-party cookies will be tracking your activities.

Ex: When you are surfing internet by logging into any of your accounts like Hotmail, Yahoo, Gmail, Online Banking, etc. your activities will be tracked by third party and referral domains.

comment.desc:
For documentation, and future references, explain the relevance of this entry with your policies.

That is, by reading the policies, a future user can understand the purpose of that entry.

profiles.desc:
Specify the Profiles applicable for this entry.

This entry will be applicable only if the connection has any one of the specified profiles.

Leave it Blank, to apply for all connections irrespective of any applied profile.

To avoid application to a connection that has a profile, use negated profile (!profile).

action.desc:
Apply 'Privacy Level' as per you requirement.

Caution: If you select 'Paranoid' level privacy, it may cause problems for web servers which give response based on User-Agent.

ELEVATED.desc:
Create the Policies for Elevated Privacy.

ALL The Following Entries will be tested from top to bottom.

Click on Add below, to add a new entry.

Example: After enabling this section and creating a policy, you are unable to log into websites with third-party account details like, you are unable to login into flipkart or amazon with Facebook or Gmail accounts.

FALSE.desc: Disable strict privacy and third party cookies blocking.

TRUE.desc: Enable strict privacy and third party cookies blocking.

NOT-REQUIRED.desc: Select this, to bypass enforcement of Elevated Privacy

LOW.desc: Select this, to block Third-Party Cookies only

STANDARD.desc: Select this, to block Third-Party Cookies and hide the HTTP(s) referrer

PARANOID.desc: Select this, to block Third-Party Cookies, Hide the HTTP(s) referrer and Hide different User-Agent

ssqore.desc:
SSqore allows you to categorize the websites, depending upon the potential nature of the content served by the web-site.

SSqore queries SafeSquid's Content Categorisation Service (CCS), to determine if a web-site belongs to one or more categories.

enabled.desc: Enable or Disable the use of SSqore engine.

heuristic.desc:
Enable or Disable the Heuristic scanning.

Enabling heuristic scanning allows you to analyze the content of a web page (response) in real-time and categorize the site instead of just URL based categorization.

dlp.desc:
Use DLP (Data loss prevention) module to prevent your users from sending sensitive or critical information outside the corporate network.

Use this section to create policies based on profiles and select the appropriate content types and action that is to be applied to each policy.

comment.desc:
For documentation and future references, explain the relevance of this entry with your policies.

That is, by reading the policies, a future user can understand the purpose of this entry.

profiles.desc:
Specify the list of Profiles that should be applicable for this entry.

This entry will be applicable only if the connection has any one of the specified profiles.

Leave it blank, to apply this entry for all connections irrespective of any applied profile.

To avoid application of this entry to a connection that has a profile, use negated profile (!profile).

mime.desc:
Select the list of upload content types or content categories, to which this entry will be applicable.

The connection should have been already profiled to have one or more of these content types or content categories to match.

Use Negation "!", to match this entry, only when specified content types or content categories are not applied to the connection.

Leave it blank to match this entry irrespective of applied content types or content categories.

If you set this to "Image, Pdf, Audio, !Text, !Jpeg", then this entry will be applicable to only those connections that have been profiled as Image, or Pdf, or Audio, or not profiled as Text or Jpeg.

action.desc: Specify action to enforce on matched connections.

DLP.desc: ALL The following Entries will be tested from top to bottom.

ALLOW.desc: Select this, if you want to allow requests matching this policy

DENY.desc: Select this, if you want to block requests matching this policy. Will not block the requests to those users who have allow bypass set from the access section.

DO_NOT_BYPASS.desc: Select, if you want to strictly block the websites.

icap.desc:
Use ICAP to perform virus scanning, content modification and blocking inappropriate content.

Here, you can integrate the SafeSquid with any ICAP (Internet Content Adaptation Protocol) based network services like:

Dr. Webâ€™s ICAP based antivirus.

Kaspersky Antivirus for Proxy Server.

Symantec Scan Engine.

Trend Micro IWSS.

You can use in DLP (Data Loss Prevention) configuration.

REQUESTS.desc: The ICAP server will be used to modify or satisfy requests.

RESPONSES.desc: The ICAP server will be used to modify responses.

NO.desc: No, Do Not include the Request Headers, in the quarantined Responses.

YES.desc: Yes, Include the Request Headers, in the quarantined Responses

NO.desc: Quarantine Infected Files But DO NOT Quarantine Clean Files

YES.desc: Quarantine Clean Files AND Infected Files

X-VIRUS-ID.desc: Inspect response headers from server and look for X-VIRUS-ID.

X-Infection-Found.desc: Inspect response headers from server and look for X-Infection-Found.

comment.desc:
For documentation, and future references, explain the relevance of this entry with your policies.

That is, by reading the policies, a future user can understand the purpose of that entry.

profiles.desc:
Specify the Profiles applicable for this entry.

This entry will be applicable only if the connection has any one of the specified profiles.

Leave it Blank, to apply for all connections, irrespective of any applied profile.

To avoid application to a connection that has a profile, use negated profile (! profile).

icaptimeout.desc: SafeSquid will timeout if the ICAP server does not respond within the specified ICAP Timeout.

file.desc: The file to request from the ICAP server.

which.desc: Which part of the HTTP request this entry applies to.

threat_string.desc:
ICAP server's response header that contains the luggable identification of the Detected Threat.

You can specify a comma-separated list of possible headers.

SafeSquid will use the first that is found in the response headers.

quarantine_enabled.desc: Preserve a local copy of the content sent to ICAP for processing

quarantine_inclreq_headers.comment: Include Request Headers in Response Quarantine
quarantine_inclreq_headers.desc: The Quarantined Response, will include the Request Headers, for co-relating responses with requests.

quarantine_clean.desc: Specify if Quarantine should be done for only when malware is detected.

quarantine_root.desc:
The folder that must be used to save the Quarantined Data.

Make sure that the Folder exists, and SafeSquid has Read / Write Permissions.

icap.desc: Here we can create the policies for ICAP section.

svscan.desc:
SvScan is a built in module in SafeSquid that protects the users against malware.

Internet browsing is unsafe while browsing certain sites which allow malware or virus.

This causes software attack on the computer, which decreases its performance.

To prevent this SafeSquid having this advance Module named SvScan to Scan the sites specially for virus or malware.

It prevents the access and downloads from that type of websites.

comment.desc:
For documentation, and future references, explain the relevance of this entry with your policies.

That is, by reading the policies, a future user can understand the purpose of that entry.

profiles.desc:
Specify the Profiles applicable for this entry.

This entry will be applicable only if the connection has any one of the specified profiles.

Leave it Blank, to apply for all connections irrespective of any applied profile.

To avoid application to a connection that has a profile, use negated profile (! profile).

scan_results.desc:
Select security level depending on your requirement.

Set security level as per your safety measures: standard or High or Paranoid.

Set scan-level to bypass for disabling the scanning.

threat_types.desc:
Select Virus/Malware type(s) to be blocked, if received content has their signature(s).

SafeSquid will block all such requests if a threat is detected and if the content is suspicious.

SvScan.desc:
Create the entries for SvScan.

Define the Security level and Malware type in each entry.

ALL The Following Entries will be tested from top to bottom.

Click on Add below, to add a new entry.

BYPASS.desc: Disable Virus Scanning for the matching Profiles.

STANDARD.desc: Block if a threat is detected, but not on mere Suspicion.

HIGH.desc: Block if a threat is detected, even if the content is suspicious.

PARANOID.desc: Block everything that SvScan can not assure clean. Warning! This can cause all content to be blocked even in the event of any systemic failures of this functionality.

SqScan is a built in module in SafeSquid that protects the users against malware.

Internet browsing is unsafe while browsing certain sites which allow malware or virus.

This causes software attack on the computer, which decreases its performance.

To prevent this SafeSquid having this advance Module named SqScan to Scan the sites specially for virus or malware.

It prevents the access and downloads from that type of websites.

imgfilter.desc:
Use this section to prevent the users from viewing pornographic image content.

This section allows you to block inappropriate images by analyzing the graphical content of an image, in real time.

The default template replaces the blocked image with a checkered box.

dtempl.desc:
Specify the template or notification message to be sent, when the entry content is matched.

The default template replaces the blocked image with a checkered box.

FALSE.desc: Disable bypass image scanning if you do not want this entry to be applied for image scanning.

TRUE.desc: Enable bypass image scanning if you want this entry to be applied for image scanning.

FALSE.desc: Block Images if score is higher than threshold

TRUE.desc: Do not block, just blur the image if possibly pornographic

comment.desc:
For documentation, and future references, explain the relevance of this entry with your policies.

That is, by reading the policies, a future user can understand the purpose of that entry.

bypass.desc: Enable or disable bypass image filter scanning.

profiles.desc:
Specify the Profiles applicable for this entry.

This entry will be applicable only if the connection has any one of the specified profiles.

Leave it Blank, to apply for all connections, irrespective of any applied profile.

To avoid application to a connection that has a profile, use negated profile (! profile).

threshold.desc:
Specify the threshold score to block images.

Images are given scores by analyzing the graphical content of an image, in real time.

-10.0 is unlikely to be porn, 0 is very likely.

Images are blocked based on the threshold score.

template.desc:
Specify the template to replace when this entry is matched.

Templates are used throughout Safesquid as a replacement for pages which can't be displayed due to filtering, error, or other conditions.

Specify the templateâ€™s name that should be displayed on a user's screen when this entry matches.

The name should be selected from the templateâ€™s section.

In template section you can find templateâ€™s name.

The default template replaces the blocked image with a checkered box.

imgfilter.desc:
Add policies to apply to the matching entries.

Images are given scores by analyzing the graphical content of an image, in real time.

-10.0 is unlikely to be porn, 0 is very likely.

Images are blocked based on the threshold score.

wccp.desc:
Use WCCP routers to enforce trasparent proxy.

Stop setting proxy in client browsers and transparently redirect traffic flows in real-time.

comment.desc:
For documentation, and future references, explain the relevance of this entry with your policies.

That is, by reading the policies, a future user can understand the purpose of that entry.

proxyhost.desc: A regular expression pattern matching the proxy hosts this entry applies to, useful if a single configuration file is shared between several proxy servers.

router_ip.desc:
Enter router IP address(s) to enable Safesquidâ€™s interaction with that router(s) for transparent redirection.

WCCP v1 can have only a single router for one service group.

WCCP v2 can have multiple routers for one service group.

traffic_capture.desc:
Select which type of traffic should be redirected. Based on this selection only, the traffic is redirected to the safesquid, from the routers in the service group.

A regular expression matching the protocol, this entry applies to; â€˜leave it empty to match any protocolâ€™. The Protocols could be: http => Simple HTTP based GET or POST requests ftp => Browser based access to FTP sites connect => SSL or tunneling (over HTTP) requests made by browsers for https sites, or FTP connections made by FTP-client utilities, or other utilities like PuTTy.

Examples: http => simple http connections http|ftp => all browser-based simple http or ftp connections ftp|connect => all forms of ftp based connections http|connect => all http and tunneling requests .

service_type.desc: Select the service type. Well known services are known services. You need not to define them. If you select dynamic services you need to describe service group with service id and other parameters.

service_id.desc: Specify the service id of the service group the value should be in between 97 and 255.

security.desc: Select security options for packet authorization. If you select no security you need not to enter password field. If you select md5security then you need to provide encrypted password that will be used for packet authentication with in service group.

enc_pwd.desc: Enter the Encrypted password for simple packet authentication.

forward_method.desc: Select forward_method. Method by which router transfer packets to the safesquid. Default it is GRE you can select Layer2 also but architectures should support it.

assignment_method.desc: Select assignment_method. Method that is used by SafeSquid when it becomes designated proxy. Default it is hash assignment and you can also select mask assignment.

packet_return_method.desc: Select packet_return_method. Method that is used by SafeSquid to return packets to router. Default it is GRE you can also select layer2.but when you select layer2 as assignment you should not select GRE as return method.

portrange.desc: WCCP2 allows to use 8 ports. You can give 8 separate ports or range of ports. A comma separated list of ports or port ranges this entry applies to.

network_protocol.desc: Select network_protocol. SafeSquid will inform selection to router.

webcache_ip.desc: Enter SafeSquid IP address(s) to interact wccp router(s) for transparent redirection.

WCCP.desc: Configure policies to use wccp v1 or wccp v2 or both.

WCCPV1.desc: WCCP version 1 will be used for this entry.

WCCPV2.desc: WCCP version 2 will be used for this entry.

HTTP.desc: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) is an application protocol for distributed, collaborative, hypermedia information systems. HTTP is the foundation of data communication for the World Wide Web. Hypertext is structured text that uses logical links (hyperlinks) between nodes containing text. HTTP is the protocol to exchange or transfer hypertext.

HTTPS.desc: Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) is a communications protocol for secure communication over a computer network, with especially wide deployment on the Internet. Technically, it is not a protocol in and of itself; rather, it is the result of simply layering the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) on top of the SSL/TLS protocol, thus adding the security capabilities of SSL/TLS to standard HTTP communications. The security of HTTPS is therefore the one of the underlying TLS, which uses long term public and secret keys to exchange a short term session key to encrypt the data flow between client and server.

FTP.desc: File Transfer Protocol (FTP) is a standard network protocol used to transfer files from one host to another host over a TCP based network, such as the Internet. FTP is built on a client-server architecture and uses separate control and data connections between the client and the server.

SFTP.desc: SSH File Transfer Protocol (also Secure File Transfer Protocol, or SFTP) is a network protocol that provides file access, file transfer, and file management functionalities over any reliable data stream. It was designed by the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) as an extension of the Secure Shell protocol (SSH) version 2.0 to provide secure file transfer capability, but is also intended to be usable with other protocols. This protocol assumes that it is run over a secure channel, such as SSH, that the server has already authenticated the client, and that the identity of the client user is available to the protocol.

WELLKNOWN.desc: Service is well known service. No need mention service group details.

DYNAMIC.desc: Service is Dynamic service. Mention service group details.

NOSECURITY.desc: No security to the packets travelling with in the Service Group.

MD5SECURITY.desc: Provide MD5 security to the packets travelling with in the Service Group.

GRE.desc: GRE forward method will be used by SafeSquid.if GRE forward method not supported by the router then SafeSquid will negotiate with router.

L2.desc: L2 forward method will be used by SafeSquid.if L2 forward method not supported by the router then SafeSquid will negotiate with router.

HASH.desc: HASH assignment method will be used by SafeSquid.if HASH assignment method not supported by the router then SafeSquid will negotiate with router.

MASK.desc: MASK assignment method will be used by SafeSquid.if MASK assignment method not supported by the router then SafeSquid will negotiate with router.

TCP.desc: SafeSquid will inform Router that it should redirect TCP packets.

UDP.desc: SafeSquid will inform Router that it should redirect UDP packets.
